title: Zophar’s First Speech: Repent and Be Wise
summary: Zophar rebukes Job for claiming to be innocent. He insists that God’s wisdom is beyond human understanding and says Job actually deserves worse. He urges Job to repent so that his life will be restored.

faq.question: What does Zophar accuse Job of?
faq.answer: Speaking arrogantly and falsely claiming innocence.

faq.question: What is Zophar’s advice?
faq.answer: To repent so that God will restore peace and hope to his life.
